title: Update extension input to support number range
body:
As a developer, I want a simple way to support input numerical ranges. When the value entered does not fit the range, show an error.

Depends on #7104 

### Description

*Type*: Feature

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 80.0 DAI (80.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7105/2019). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7105/2019). * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $43,738.78 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)

@jeluard  I may want to work on this, but I'm not sure exactly what is needed. Is it like a helper function which extension events can call as a number range check? What would a usage example look like?
@krisc It should be extra parameters on the input component allowing to specify input value boundaries. This depends on #7104
@StatusSceptre Can we accept @Alexanmtz ?
Yes @jeluard! Defintely. I just want to know afterwards if I have to solve the #7104 as well before start on this
@alexanmtz I believe it makes more sense yes as this one would probably build on the other one?

The other one was canceled on Gitcoin, so I can started on that but this would be two tasks, don't you think? You can reactivate the other one or consider the scope of this one to be this issue and the dependency.

@alexanmtz Yes definitely. I don't know why it's been canceled but you can assume the same bounty will be made available.

@StatusSceptre Can you take a look at that?

Ok, great @jeluard , I will wait the other one be available again so I can apply for that one first, once you approved I start on that one and then we proceed for this one after we merge the dependency.
Feel free to start, we pay all our bounties ;)
Ok @jeluard , great!
getting through a lot of backlog where things slipped through the cracks.  All is good here.

I've stopped work on this bounty.  Please re-apply if you'd like to work on it @alexanmtz or if you were currently working on it.  You have priority but it's been stale for a while.  We apologize for the lack of response here, the bounty process is getting taken over and getting a more watchful eye.
